abstracts.cdata!:
This is the environmental assessment
            (EA) which identifies potential negative impacts resulting
            from the implementation of the Huai River Water Pollution
            Control Project, reviews the project area to examine the
            physical, and biological environmental aspects, and proposes
            mitigating measures on specifically, the Anhui and Shandong
            Province components. Socio-cultural aspects are covered
            separately in the Resettlement Action Plan. Potential
            construction, and operational impacts are relatively minor,
            and have been sorted according to their geographic location,
            addressed in the design of wastewater collection, and
            treatment facilities, to control effluent discharge and
            sludge disposal. Mitigating measures include budget
            allowances for laboratory construction and equipment, to
            perform the required testing by each utility. Detailed
            technical assistance, and training programs will be
            developed to address environmental institutional
            strengthening, and monitoring. Mitigation include: 1)
            contract provisions, through precautionary clauses to
            minimize dust, and air quality, and ensure safety; 2)
            limited operating schedules, and adequate equipment to abate
            noise disturbances; 3) ordinance enforcement to improve
            treatment systems, and solid waste collection on waterways;
            and, 4) monitor wastewater discharges through sewerage
            inspections, and testing.
